description:
**Problem**
REALTIME_PLAN §16.2 specifies `admin.flush` to force fsync for a namespace (and optionally trigger a checkpoint). There is no admin flush handler or IPC/CLI surface; `src/daemon/admin.rs` only has status/metrics/doctor/scrub/reload/maintenance/rotate. This leaves no explicit manual durability/flush hook.

**Design**
- Add admin IPC op + CLI subcommand `bd admin flush [--namespace] [--checkpoint-now]` (namespace default core).
- Implement daemon handler to call WAL fsync for the namespace and optionally enqueue checkpoint for affected groups.
- Surface in `src/api` + renderers; include timing/durability info in response.

**Acceptance**
- [ ] IPC + CLI `admin flush` exists and returns success payload.
- [ ] WAL fsync performed for requested namespace.
- [ ] `--checkpoint-now` schedules a checkpoint for groups including that namespace.
- [ ] Tests cover handler + response shape.

**Files:** src/daemon/admin.rs, src/daemon/ipc.rs, src/cli/mod.rs, src/cli/render.rs, src/api
title: admin.flush missing (fsync + optional checkpoint trigger)

description:
**Problem**
HLC relies on wall clock time. If a machine clock jumps backward or is far ahead, its stamps can dominate LWW merges and effectively overwrite other actors' updates. This can look like data loss.

**Design**
Persist the last-seen WriteStamp (per-repo) and clamp local wall_ms to >= last_seen.wall_ms. If local time moves backwards, advance logical counter instead of wall time. Add skew detection (warn if now << last_seen or now >> last_seen by threshold). Consider storing max observed stamp in meta or WAL to survive restarts.

**Acceptance**
- [ ] Stamps remain monotonic across restarts and backward clock jumps.
- [ ] Skew detection is surfaced (status/log).
- [ ] Tests simulate backward/forward jumps and verify monotonicity + merge ordering.

**Files:** src/daemon/clock.rs, src/core/time.rs, src/daemon/core.rs
title: Clock skew can break LWW ordering
Add require_live helper to eliminate bead lookup boilerplate
